item.title: [PI]When making a command
item.dc:creator: @Zosedan Zosedan
item.description:
@Zosedan wrote:

[quote=“Kayceee, post:6, topic:427064”]Just copy your yell command and modify it 

					for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) {
						if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
							Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j];
						c2.sendMessage(+ c.playerName + ": @dre@ has just arrived at Chill City!" + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)));
						}
					}

Something like that, but obviously slightly modified to whatever you want… lol[/quote]

That’s pretty much exactly what I said aside from changing iterator i to j…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]When making a command
item.dc:creator: @Kayceee Kayceee
item.description:
@Kayceee wrote:

Just copy your yell command and modify it 

					for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) {
						if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
							Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j];
						c2.sendMessage(+ c.playerName + ": @dre@ has just arrived at Chill City!" + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)));
						}
					}

Something like that, but obviously slightly modified to whatever you want… lol

item.title: [PI]When making a command
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:3, topic:427064”][quote author=Wet Dreamss link=topic=529765.msg3867081#msg3867081 date=1325093010]
something similar to.

if.PlayerinChillCity = true; c.sendmessage("player name has just entered chill city!"); else if {

Note: This won’t be near working if you just copy and paste, it’s just a base.
[/quote]
Not message only to player, I mean message to everyone, such as yell.[/quote]
ohhh, well use the default global message system? Except just make an else if { under it, so that people out of the city don’t see it

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]When making a command
item.dc:creator: @Zosedan Zosedan
item.description:
@Zosedan wrote:

You could do:

for(int i=0; i<Server.playerHandler.players.length; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { Client c = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c.sendMessage(playerName +" is now in Chill City to chill and relax! Come and join him/her at ::chill city!"); } }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]When making a command
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

When making a command, how do you make it send a message to everyone too. For example:

				        if (playerCommand.equals("Chill City")) {
				c.getPA().startTeleport(2815, 3182, 0, "modern");
				c.getItems().addItem(1038, 1);
				c.getItems().addItem(1040, 1);
				c.getItems().addItem(1042, 1);
				c.getItems().addItem(1044, 1);
				c.getItems().addItem(1046, 1);
				c.getItems().addItem(1048, 1);
				c.getItems().addItem(1050, 1);
				c.getItems().addItem(1053, 1);
				c.getItems().addItem(1055, 1);
				c.getItems().addItem(1058, 1);
				c.sendMessage("Welcome to Chill City! + Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +, you should relax, take a break from all your hard training!");
			}

How would I make it so that it also tells everyone that the player is at the Chill City. I know how to do it in Delta though:

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" is now in Chill City to chill and relax! Come and join him/her at ::chill city!";

Though not in PI.

Read full topic
